cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi SE of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the eastern and central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS/AL border area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast near the LA-MS border (north-central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ochlockonee River FL to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from the western Florida Panhandle through Alabama, Mississippi, and southeastern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 mph) possible Monday; brief gusts to 50+ mph if further intensification occurs and the center tracks closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft surge in and around Mobile Bay during Monday–Tuesday onshore flow and rising tides.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated totals to 6 inches Sunday night through Tuesday, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents beginning Sunday; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands.
